intro: Amsinckia ciliata, commonly known as the fringed bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant features basal leaves with finely toothed margins and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its fruit is a dry, pod-like structure that splits open to release seeds. Amsinckia ciliata is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
